sn22.76:4.5: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with proper understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.76:4.12: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with proper understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.76:5.1: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with form, feeling,
sn22.76:5.7: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn22.76:5.8: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
sn22.76:5.9: As far as there are abodes of sentient beings, even up until the pinnacle of existence, the perfected ones are the foremost and the best.”
sn22.76:6.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn22.76:6.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn22.76:7.2: Craving is not found in them,
sn22.76:7.3: the conceit ‘I am’ is cut off,
sn22.76:7.4: and the net of delusion is burst open.
sn22.76:8.3: Nothing in the world clings to them,
sn22.76:9.2: their domain is the seven good qualities.
sn22.76:10.2: and trained in the three trainings,
sn22.76:10.4: with fear and terror given up.
sn22.76:11.3: These are the best in the world,
sn22.76:11.4: craving is not found in them.
sn22.76:12.4: in the core of the spiritual path.
sn22.76:13.1: Unwavering in the face of discrimination,
sn22.76:13.3: They’ve reached the level of the tamed,
sn22.76:13.4: in the world, they’re the winners.
sn22.76:14.2: relishing is not found in them.
sn22.76:14.4: ‘The awakened are supreme in the world!’”
